md:
giải nghĩa từ "tight" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan.

* Tight (adjective)
	+ Meaning: Closely fitted or packed; not loose.
	+ Vietnamese: Chặt, khít, chặt chẽ.
	+ Example sentence: The tight deadline made it difficult for us to finish the project on time.
	+ Related words: loose, snug, firm, secure.

* Tight (verb)
	+ Meaning: To make or become tighter.
	+ Vietnamese: Chặt lại, siết lại.
	+ Example sentence: You need to tighten the screw to make sure it's secure.
	+ Related words: loosen, relax, release.

* Tight (adverb)
	+ Meaning: Firmly or closely.
	+ Vietnamese: Chặt chẽ, khít khao.
	+ Example sentence: She held the rope tight as she climbed up the mountain.
	+ Related words: loosely, firmly, securely.

Note: The meanings and example sentences are provided in English, and the Vietnamese translations are provided in the Vietnamese language.
html:

  • Tight (adjective)

    • Vietnamese: Chặt, khít, chặt chẽ.

  • Tight (verb)

    • Meaning: To make or become tighter.
    • Vietnamese: Chặt lại, siết lại.
    • Example sentence: You need to tighten the screw to make sure it's secure.
    • Related words: loosen, relax, release.

  • Tight (adverb)

    • Meaning: Firmly or closely.
    • Vietnamese: Chặt chẽ, khít khao.
    • Example sentence: She held the rope tight as she climbed up the mountain.
    • Related words: loosely, firmly, securely.

Note: The meanings and example sentences are provided in English, and the Vietnamese translations are provided in the Vietnamese language.
